resources.string: Careful! No stepping on my honeysuckle! Hard enough to grow anything in this bleeding place without bootprints through my flower bed.\n\nHad to import my own hives just to get the flowers blooming.

This is who we really are, stranger. Cowards, the lot of us. Willing to plow under friends and neighbors just to save our own hide.\n\nSome crimes aren’t meant to be forgiven. Believe me… I know better than most.

Tread careful, stranger. The longer you stay in this place, the more like you are to lose yourself.\n\nOnce, I was like you: proud and brave. Then, the man I trusted most took the sword from my hand, and handed me a shovel…

Best keep on the march, stranger. See in this place, sometimes your final rest ain’t your final rest.\n\nAnd when the dead get restless, we give them to the earth here. You don’t want to be around when they get restless, do you?

You don’t know what it was like, stranger. Friends and loved ones going about their day, minding their own, off they go into town, and they come back Lost!\n\nWe just wanted to spare the families that pain.

Gone you say? Well that don’t change a thing!\n\nI swore I’d keep the dark ones turning in their graves until the waters take this place. I’ll see to it the dead stay buried, for so long as I can still lift a shovel!

I hear the Vigil’s shuffled off the old mortal coil? Well, curse or no curse, the dead here are still restless.\n\nAnd it’s up to old Nik to keep them tethered to the ground. It’s a dirty job, friend. But for the sake of old Calvary, somebody’s got to do it.

Eggs, almonds, vanilla, a touch of rosewater, and… magic!\n\nGuten tag, stranger! I am Sebastian, confectioner extraordinaire. For what else is there to live for in this God-forsaken place? Now please, try the marzipan. It is wunderbar!

These are dark days, friend. But in here, things are always sweet! Enjoy a sample of the butchtel.\n\nLike the sun rising above the clouds, bringing a rush of fresh air. Keep the bounce in your step as you stand tall against the dark powers that prowl this accursed place!

Ah, my friend! At last, we are free! There is hope again in the eyes of the people.\n\nThis calls for a celebration. I must bake a great cake! One that will do justice to such a momentous occasion. A masterpiece!

Where am I from? There is a land to the Northwest of here, stranger. My Empress is most concerned about the happenings here.\n\nFrom the Corruption massing to the north, to the scourge of the Lost, I have been sent to learn of these new threats.
Take care who you choose to serve, stranger.\n\nThe enemy of your enemy is not always your friend. The things men do in the grip of fear are not always guided by reason.
Tread carefully, friend. The Lost are not easily laid to rest, and those with a sense of grievance or sanctimony usually do not go quietly.\n\nKeep your blade true and your wits about you.

Fate, it seems, is not done with you. It pleases me that you are well.\n\nThis strange place needs warriors like you, who will stand against the tide of unnatural forces until the price of eternity comes due.
Strange. So strange! Bark, roots, leaves, branches—the power of Azoth permeates them all.\n\nWhere else but here could such an oddity exist? Have you ever seen such a marvel, stranger? Praise be!
Out of balance? Nonsense!\n\nThis land is positively teeming with all the energies of the universe! Life itself runs through the very soil.
You’ve seen it? Touched it? And come back to tell the tale?\n\nYou are very lucky, stranger! This land has offered up its blessings, and you have been found worthy.
The balance has been restored! Yes… I feel it now.\n\nThe flow seems steadier. Somehow stronger. I did not know one could improve on perfection, but here it is!
Don’t make any trouble, outsider. Just because times are hard doesn’t mean you can simply do as you please.\n\nThere are laws here in Calvary and they are strictly enforced!
There are no heroes out there, walking the road, waiting to come save us.\n\nWe have to find the strength to save ourselves!

Do you know what it takes to protect a home in times like these, stranger? To make hard choices to keep the ones you love safe?\n\nPeople were scared! Order was breaking down! We did what we had to do.

It was true what I said about hard times, stranger. But I always had doubts.\n\nThe cost has been so great. Perhaps… in the end, we all reap what we have sown. I pray that, in time, I may be forgiven.
Maybe now that the Vigil’s reign of terror is over, we can begin to trust each other once more.

What’s it like out there, friend? Living by your wits, fighting the good fight. I’d be like to follow you if it weren’t for I’m needed here.\n\nKnighthood’s grand, but there’s no town without a good mason to put one stone on top of another.
So chivalry’s dead, is it? I suppose nothing endures in this strange new world of ours.\n\nThe Bright Vigil were supposed to be a light in these dark times.
The Bright Vigil has fallen? Good riddance. Maybe someone like you can be a new beacon for Brightwood in the darkness.\n\nYou give us hope that there are still heroes in this world.
I thought the Bright Vigil was standing tall to protect us from the dark forces, but it was we who needed protecting from them!
Well then, welcome to Brightwood, I suppose.\n\nMind your soul around these parts - they tend to get Lost.
Don't know what you've heard about Brightwood, stranger, but it may well be true.\n\nWe've been dug in here battling the soulless Lost for centuries.
As difficult as it may be to accept the truths you exposed, I think we made a difference in the fight against the Lost here.\n\nI've heard Weaver's Fen still has its fair share of challenges as well.
I heard you eventually made your way out to the Fen!\n\nI've also heard the Lost there are even worse than they are here. I can't imagine.
Hi there! I'm actually quite new to Brightwood myself.\n\nThings got weird in Ebonscale, so I decided to take my chances here.
I trust you've heard at least some of the history of Brightwood?\n\nI only know a little myself, but it seems clear the territory is haunted in more ways than one.
Reaper's Locus (Expedition)
Defeat the Starstone Reaper and Collect the Reaper's Locus. Talk to Herbalist Lau in the Brightwood Settlement when the task is done.
You know, I've come to the conclusion that you and I - we have a lot in common.\n\nWe're both newcomers to Brightwood, and I want to follow your example.
"Really? Why?"
Because I plan on staying here! And that means I should make this town a better place.\n\nBut unlike you, I'm no warrior.
"If there's fighting to be done, I'll help."
Ah, thank you for catching my meaning. There is a terrible creature that haunts the Shattered Obelisk, so you'll need friends.\n\nA Reaper who once culled creatures to collect their azoth.
"That's appalling."
Like so much else in Brightwood, though you've done much to remedy that.\n\nThe Reaper would've used some kind of Locus to collect azoth--that's what I need.
Before you go marching into the Shattered Obelisk, I'd suggest finding some friends.\n\nThe Reaper isn't the only horror prowling those ruins.
Oh, it's about time. You're such a talent, I frankly expected you to return much sooner.\n\nBut don't get me wrong--I'm very grateful. I'll take the Locus, and you can have this.
"What are you going to do with it?"
Use it! Not to collect more azoth, the very thought turns my stomach.\n\nBut this Locus contains enough azoth to boost plant growth and enhance potions. The possibilities are endless!
Delve into Starstone Barrows to collect the Starstone Reaper's Locus
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Welcome, welcome! Thank you again for finding that Locus.\n\nUsing it safely has been tricky, but I promise, I'm taking every precaution.
I see you, stranger, and I see your soul.\n\nStrong it may be, but is it strong enough?
Secrets of the Earth
Collect spores from Bronzeroot Warriors in Pendle Hollow and bone dust from the Lost at Pendleton. Return to Embalmer Bankole when the task is complete.
Brightwood is no different than anywhere else on Aeternum.\n\nWe see the Lost as enemies, but we don't realize what terrible suffering they endure.
"We should feel sorry for the Lost?"
Of course.\n\nI have been here longer than these others, long enough that no one listens to old Bankole any more.
"I'm listening."

Then heed this: the Angry Earth's Bronzeroot Warriors seem to naturally repel the Lost.\n\nWith spores from them, and bone dust from the Lost, I could create a talisman to repel the Lost without violence.
The Bronzeroot Warriors are a new expression of the Angry Earth, but they know the old ways.\n\nI only hope my efforts do not add to the suffering of the Lost.
These satchels... their scent... do you smell it? Moss spores.\n\nIt makes sense, does it not? That which withers with half-death is susceptible to the energy of fresh life.
Components for the Embalmer's Talismans :
Venture into {POITags} for Lost Bone Dust
Collect {itemName} from the Lost in {POITags}
Acquire Angry Earth Spores in {POITags}
Collect {itemName}s from Bronzeroot Dryads in {POITags}
Earth Will Provide
Defeat the Bronzewood Dryads who are guarding stores of precious alkahest. Meet back up with Embalmer Bankole east of Bronzegrove.
What you have brought me is powerful, but it is not enough.\n\nWe need something to refine the moss spores.
"Don't know where I'd find that."
Fortunately, I do.\n\nThe Angry Earth have overrun Ancient ruins to the south. There may still be rare reagents in the ruins, though you will have to cut a path through the dryads.
What drew the Angry Earth into the ruins?\n\nDid they seek power within? We may never know…
A potent alkahest? Perfect, perfect.\n\nI did not think anyone else would consider the plight of the Lost. But you have. Thank you.
Travel to {POITags} to acquire more potent reagents
Destroy {targetName} in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
I will remain, to observe the Angry Earth and Lost.\n\nWith time and patience, I hope to have a talisman that can hold the Lost at bay without violence. There has been enough suffering in Brightwood.
It seems unfair that we spend decades here battling the Lost, only to now face a new threat.\n\nI hope the Corruption doesn't spread any further.
You've done Brightwood a kindness, traveler.\n\nWe've finally gotten a chance to catch our collective breath…before the next threat looms.
Move along you, I won't go so far as to draw steel against you, but it doesn't mean I want to chit-chat.
Duty calls me to Brightwood, where strength is truly tested. I am at home here. We shall see if you have equal mettle.
Duty calls me to Brightwood, where strength is truly tested. I am at home here. We shall see if you have equal mettle.\n\n[ Level 24 required for Brightwood faction missions ]
Those books can't prepare you for Brightwood. No matter, as I'll enjoy picking over your corpse in due time.
You light bringers bore me. If your belief really worked, then why does the darkness remain here? Save your breath. I already know.
Ah, one who wanders without knowledge of their destination. How curious.
The quest to know and understand is our shared duty. How may I service you, fellow erudite?
The quest to know and understand is our shared duty. Return when you understand more.\n\n[ Level 24 required for Brightwood faction missions ]
Oh this will be fascinating! A Marauder brute here in Brightwood. I look forward to learning from your failures.
Yes, come hither my senseless friend. Tell me again how belief in fairy tales helps to solve mankind's ills. I never tire of it.
My child, having not chosen a path is still a choice. It's never too late to leave darkness for the light.
Ah, a fellow seeker of justice. It will be my sacred honor to assist you.
Ah, a fellow seeker of justice. It will be my sacred honor to assist you.\n\n[ Level 24 required for Brightwood faction missions ]
Well aren't you a strong-looking one! Not that it'll do you much good here in Brightwood. But then, choices do have consequences, and I'm afraid you chose unwisely, Marauder.
Oh my dear, so much rushing about, trying to learn everything. Such a pointless waste, when all we need is belief in a just cause.
Oh dear, you startled me! The spooks and spirits of this town have got me on edge.\n\nWell, let me welcome you to the Vigil's Rest. We guarantee that our guests will rest in peace. Ha.
Hello, I'm Master Fisher Park! Fishing and Alchemy are my trades.
Salutations. I'm Master Fisher Park! Fishing and Alchemy are my trades.
My research is going along well, thanks to you.
When I heard the rumors from Everfall, I knew it wouldn't be long.\n\nThe Corrupted have come to Brightwood in full force.
Infernal Armaments
Disrupt the Corrupted war effort by defeating their leaders at Corlew's Mine and Shervey's Lumbermill. Then meet with Ranger Shui Tijong outside of Calvary.
I had thought to seek support from rangers in other territories, but I think you and I can handle this.\n\nI do the reconnaissance, you carry out the assault.
"That seems to work."
The main thrust of the Corrupted operations here is the mission to supply their forces with armaments.\n\nThey have a start-to-finish process under way, mining the ore and forging the weapons.
"Where are they most vulnerable?"
The core of the operation is here in the mines, and around the mill to the south.\n\nIf you can cut the heads off both snakes, so to speak, they will be crippled.
We cannot let them keep extracting resources from the land.\n\nThere is barely enough to sustain the people of Brightwood as it is.
Well done. They still control both locations, but it won't do them much good.\n\nBut you look troubled. Did you discover something?
"Designs from a Corrupted smith."
Oh no. Master Smith McCoy? He went missing weeks ago.\n\nI called off the search for him when it became too dangerous, but I never dreamed….
Sabotage the Corrupted mining operation at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName} to disrupt the Corrupted's weapon supply
Reclaim {itemName} from chests in {POITags}
Investigate the Corrupted logging operation at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Belly of the Corrupted
Sabotage the food supply chain for the Corrupted at Reida's Burrow. Talk to Ranger Shui Tijong near Calvary when the task is done.
I can't dwell on past failures. The present peril is too great.\n\nThe Corrupted still have a major presence at Reida's Burrow.
"We should strike there next."
My thoughts exactly - we can warn the settlement later. We must strike hard and fast.\n\nI have been watching the Corrupted forces' movements since they arrived.
"Have you seen any patterns?"

Yes. They seized this area to use it as a critical part of their supply chain for food and weapons.\n\nAn army marches on its belly, so let's strike their food supplies first, and destroy their hunters.
If we destroy the hunters and claim all their rations, the Corrupted forces' supply lines will be in dire straits.
Well done, friend. With their rations stolen and their hunters compromised, the Corrupted will be hungry.\n\nHungry soldiers are desperate soldiers and desperate soldiers are sloppy.
Sabotage the Corrupted Supply Chain at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
I will remain and keep an eye on the Corrupted operations here.\n\nThough I suspect it will be some time before their supply lines are back in order, thanks to you.
They really should advertise the beauty of Greyvale. There is something marvelous about the ancient trees and the sparkling water.\n\nDon't you find all this nature inspiring?
Location Scout
Search for vibrant waterfalls for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
Have you seen, really seen the landscape of Greyvale? The light falling through the leaves, or dancing across the lakes.\n\nOh, if only I had time to paint everything here!
"You don’t have time?"

Sadly, I don’t have time to both find all the beautiful locations and paint them. Searching cannot be rushed, and it takes me so long to get my paints arranged just how I like them.\n\nBut perhaps you could help!
"What do you mean?

You could go and find the most beautiful locations for me to paint.\n\nYou will save me a lot of time if you set up an easel at each waterfall you find, then come back and tell me about them. It will be perfect!
I need some inspiration, something that jumps out of the landscape and onto a canvas!\n\nGo on, I'm counting on you to find it!
Marvelous! The rushing water, the way the sunlight glints through the trees. Yes, yes! I can work with this.
"What will you do now?"
Now that you’ve marked these locations in my map, I have to get my paints in order.\n\nBut, it wouldn't do to get all ready to start, only to be missing the correct shade of blue.
Scout Northern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout South of Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout North of Lake Genevieve for a waterfall
Eye for Reflection
Search for dynamic waterfalls for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
There’s something to be said about the energy in moving water, the way it draws your eye and catches it. The power that just leaps off the canvas and fills a room.
"The power?"
How dynamic it makes an image. How alive you feel when seeing it. How it moves, even when still.\n\nI can already tell these waterfalls will be best sellers. I’m going to need more locations!
"More waterfalls?"
Yes! There are so many located in Greyvale. It is a painter’s paradise.\n\nI could use your discerning eye to find more waterfalls for my paintings.
You were such help before that I need your help again.\n\nSearch for energetic waterfalls I can use as reference.
These are magnificent! Thank you for marking their locations on my map. I can only hope my waterfall paintings are able to compete with what is already out there.
"What do you mean?"
I’m not the only landscape painter on Aeternum. Painter Cole is already famous for her ‘Bear in Meadow’ and ‘Mountain Dawn’ paintings which are popular in the settlements.
Scout Southern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout Northern Greyvale for a waterfall
Scout Western Greyvale for a waterfall
Wolcott's Masterpiece
Search for picturesque lakes for Wolcott to paint and place an easel at each one. Talk to Painter Wolcott in Brightwood when the task is done.
Waterfalls are thrilling indeed, but I also like to paint more tranquil landscapes.\n\nThere’s nothing quite as soothing at staring at a placid lake, don't you agree? It’s almost magical.
"There are some nice lakes around here."
I’ve decided that my next collection of paintings will be of the local lakes.\n\nSomething restful to the eye, and calming to the soul. They are certain to be popular!
"What about the waterfalls?"
I’ll paint them too! I need to paint all of them in order to keep up with that overachiever Cole.\n\nPlease find three inspiring lakes where you can place my easel.
The waterfalls you found before were just lovely.\n\nNow I need three lakes for my next paintings!

Superb! The locations you have chosen fit perfectly within the landscape, like a slice of sky fallen to the ground.\n\nPainting these lakes will be a joy. And Cole hasn’t painted anything like them yet!
"She hasn’t?"
No, I will be the first to paint these lakes! Soon my name will be known as the painter of lakes and waterfalls.\n\nThank you for marking these in my map. I can’t wait to get to work!
Scout Central Greyvale for a lake
Scout Northern Greyvale for a lake
Scout Eastern Greyvale for a lake
Thanks to your help, my name shall be known in every household in Aeternum.\n\nMy paintings shall grace the walls of everyone who longs for a slice of nature to call their own.
Trees live for so long, and experience so much. I wish I could know what they know.
A Simple Tea
Collect Undefiled Tea Leaves from Verdant Cavern and Lush Sugarsap from the Lush Hideaway. Bring them back to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood.
Do you sense it, traveler? The force of life rides on the breeze from the south - the only vibrant flora remaining in these dead lands.\n\nIf you are headed that way, I could use a favor.
"What do you need?"
The soullessness of the Lost has ravaged Brightwood for centuries. Some say the land is cursed.\n\nBut the Angry Earth thrive down there, despite all the death around them.
"What's their secret?"

The Angry Earth have many secrets, but the one I seek is related to a tea they drink.\n\nThe Bronzeroot of the Verdant Cavern carry special tea leaves, and there is a particular sap they use as sweetener.
I do not only ask for tea ingredients for myself.\n\nCollect the leaves and honey, and I will share my recipe with you.
Ah, do you have them, then? Yes, these leaves are perfect!\n\nThe tea I can brew from these leaves, well, I am not even sure of all of its properties.
Gather Tea Leaves in {POITags}
Colllect {itemName} from Angry Earth chests in {POITags}
Collect Lush Sugarsap in {POITags}
Harvest {itemName} from the Young Trees in {POITags}
Azoth Tree Achene
Defeat the Angry Earth Leader Ceran at the Azoth Tree and collect his Achene. Talk to Naturalist Khunbish in Brightwood when the task is done.
Now it is time for you to repay my generosity.\n\nThe secrets of the Angry Earth are not lightly shared, and I have need of your strength.
"What? I didn't agree to anything else."
No? Do you not wish to slash, burn, and loot? Is that not what your kind does?\n\nNo matter. You must defeat a dryad named Ceran.
"Why? What did he do?"
It's a long and tiresome tale.\n\nBut if you insist, I will tell it to you--after you have fought Ceran and brought me his Achene.
Ceran… how long has it been?\n\nHe hoped I had forgotten. But I do not forget, and I do not forgive.
Ceran is gone, and you have restored the true order here.\n\nIf you wish it, you have earned the whole truth.
"It's about time."
Mind your manners, human. Before Ceran, I was guardian of the Azoth Tree.\n\nWith him gone, and a powerful brew of tea, I can assume my proper form and place.
Defeat the Angry Earth Leader at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Begone, human. As I resume my place among the Angry Earth, I cannot guarantee your safety.\n\nYour generosity, however, we will remember, for all time.
If you're headed into Greyvale, I'd offer you one piece of advice.\n\nDon't feed the bears! Especially not with your own flesh and blood.
Bear Co-Habitation
Help Hunter Hutchison in Brightwood get vengeance against some savage bears in Greyvale that destroyed his family.
Say there, are you headed across the river, into Greyvale?\n\nThat's bear territory. I know that firsthand, because for me, it was also my home.
"You don't live there any more?"
No. They don't want me. They've made that painfully clear.\n\nMy wife Susan and I lived among them for decades, in perfect harmony. Until a few months ago.
"What happened?"

One day they turned on us, tore us both apart and feasted on our flesh. Susan… she became Lost after that.\n\nI don't know why I'm still here, except for revenge. In fact, destroy a few of those beasts for me, and I'll reward you.
I still can't get over it. Out of nowhere, they just turned on us.\n\nHelp me get my vengeance, and I'll be in your debt.
I heard those bastards snarling and growling all the way down here.\n\nWhy, we're only giving them what they deserve.
Destroy {targetName} in {POITags}
Papa Bear (Elite)
Hunter Hutchison has asked you to destroy Gren, the massive bear who killed his wife, and reclaim his wife's ring. Bring the ring back to Hunter Hutchinson in Brightwood.
If I'm being completely honest, though, I really don't know what I'm supposed to do.\n\nWith Susan gone, and the bears turned on me, I don't have anywhere else to go.
"Any family anywhere?"
Nah, Susan and these bears are the only real family I ever had.\n\nLiving out there, foraging for honey, hibernating… it's the only life I know, the only place I feel at home.
"Maybe you should stay then."

Angry as I am, it's the only thing that feels right. I guess I could try.\n\nIt was the patriarch, Gren, that turned on us. If you can destroy Gren and recover Susan's ring, I might have a chance. Be careful, though.
It was that monster Gren that ate my sweet wife.\n\nDestroy him, and then I can return to the family, those I have left.

It's done then? That monstrosity of a bear gone? You're a brave soul, and a hardy one too.\n\nAll right, I'll work up the nerve and go back home. If they turn on me again, I don't know. Guess I'll end up like Susan.
Track down the Alpha Bear at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Still working up the nerve. This is harder than I thought.\n\nIt's funny, those bears are the only family I've ever known - not sure if I'll ever feel completely comfortable with them, though.
If you're looking for the Brightwood settlement, it's to the north.\n\nNothing to the south, except for lost love... and remorse.
Memories of Another Life
Megara Pantazis lived in the Walsham area many decades ago. She's asked you to retrieve her mementos from the town and return them to her in Brightwood so she can relive her past.

It may seem hard to believe, but this was once one of the safest and liveliest parts of Brightwood.\n\nAll that remains now are my memories, very sad ones, I'm afraid. And now, even those are starting to fade.
"What happened?"
The town of Walsham fell to the Lost… it's been more years than I can count.\n\nBelieve it or not, the wedding was on this very spot--a moment I never want to forget. He was the love of my life.
"He's become Lost?"

Yes, he fell to despair. I had too much pride for that--I picked up and started over, many times since.\n\nNow, I just want those memories. If you venture into town; I'd love you to recover some of my old keepsakes.
Those years in Walsham were the best I had.\n\nIf you could recover those mementos, it would mean a lot.
I'm amazed. You managed to find all these pieces of my past, even my old diary.\n\nIt's sad, isn’t it? Or it should be.
Search for Megara's Mementos in {POITags}
Search for {itemName} in chests in {POITags}
Read Megara's Diary in {POITags}
Search for Megara's Diary in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} in {POITags}
Til Death do us Part
Megara Pantazis has admitted the love of her life was actually Pastor Prewitt. She's asked you be sure nothing of his human nature remains. Talk to her in Brightwood when the task is complete.
Reading this is like visiting an old friend - it's very… emotional.\n\nBut rather than making me sad, it's making me angry. You see, when the truth came out, everyone in town turned on me.
"When what truth came out?"
The truth about my true love. I didn't tell you the whole story.\n\nThe wedding that took place here, it wasn't where I married my true love, it's where I met him.
"Whose wedding was it?"
Oh, it was mine, but my betrothed was dull as dirt. I don't even remember his name.\n\nPastor Prewitt was the one who married us. He… became the love of my life.
"Do you want to see him again?"
Yes. No? I don't know any more.\n\nIf you could confront him, and see if there is any humanity left in him, I might be able to make my choice.
My love was a formidable man in life.\n\nI suspect he will be difficult to defeat. Do take care.
Tell me, did you see him? Did he seem miserable as a Lost, or actually at peace? What did you find?\n\nWhat is this?
"A letter addressed to you."

Let me see it then… what's this? He became Lost to avoid facing me?! Apparently, he couldn't bear the town's shame and scorn.\n\nThe coward! Well, Pastor, maybe you have convinced me to live! Thank you!
Confront Pastor Prewitt at the Walsham Congregation
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
It just goes to show, life is only for those bold and courageous enough to truly live it.\n\nThank you for reminding me of that, in my darkest hour. I think maybe now, I can start over.
Sample spooky whisper subtitle from Isabella
Whisper Test 1
Whisper Test 2
Whisper Test 3
The villages don't look at all inviting, and the villagers even less.\n\nUgh, maybe this isn't the right place after all. Where did I put my map?
Earthly Treasures
Aethelwynn, a self-proclaimed treasure hunter, needs help finding lucrative graves in Brightwood. Find records of Brightwood's residents, then return to Aethelwynn near Deggendorf.
Hello? Oh, thank goodness, you're not one of the wandering Lost.\n\nI'm Aethelwynn, and you're the friendliest face I've seen all day.
"This isn't a very friendly place."
You don't need to tell me twice. The Lost get violent when you poke through their houses.\n\nOh, don't look at me like that. Everyone has to make a living.
"And what's yours?"

Reclaiming treasure! Brightwood's so full of graves, it's hard to know where to start.\n\nSay, if you're heading into the villages, could you thin out the Lost and look for any records? They might contain clues, and I'll share anything I find with you.
Do you think the Lost remember anything they did when they were alive?\n\nHmm…no, forget it. Just thinking about it gives me the shivers.

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: Aethelwynn - Brightwood
string.name: Aethelwynn

resources.string: Just about done reading through these records.\n\nMy eyes are swimming, but it'll be worth it in the end. It has to be.

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: Aethelwynn - Brightwood
string.name: Aethelwynn

resources.string: You made that look easy. Have you been treasure-hunting before?\n\nThe handwriting in these records is awful, but I can puzzle it out. Then it's just a matter of matching up names with graves!
Search {POITags} to help Aethelwynn find treasures left by the Lost
Defeat Lost
Search {POITags} to help Aethelwynn find treasures left by the Lost
Search chests at {POITags} for {itemName}
Lost and Returned
Aethelwynn has identified two promising graves that might contain treasure. Scatter the lost defending the coffins, and investigate each grave. Then, return to Aethelwynn with your spoils.
I was about to go looking for you, {playerName}!\n\nYou'll never guess what I found in those moldy old records.

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: UI - Player Prompt

resources.string: "So now we find treasures?"

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: Aethelwynn - Brightwood
string.name: Aethelwynn

resources.string: Yes! Maybe. I hope so.\n\nSome coffins in Brightwood weren't… buried properly, if you catch my meaning. Let's start with the easy pickings and see what we find.

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: UI - Player Prompt

resources.string: "Alright, I'll search the coffins."

string.comment: NOTE: The loc for this quest was intentionally re-ordered
string.speaker: Aethelwynn - Brightwood
string.name: Aethelwynn

resources.string: The coffins should be pretty old by now, so a good push will force their lids off.\n\nDon't ask me how I know.
The coffins should be pretty old by now, so a good push will force their lids off.\n\nDon't ask me how I know.
Is that a basket? Oh… the color's still as bright as a robin's egg.\n\nFair's fair, and I promised to split the treasure with you. You keep the coin, and I'll take this basket.
"Really? You don't want any coin?"
W-well, you've been really helpful, and I'll want your help again in the future.\n\nBrightwood's overflowing with abandoned cemeteries. I'm sure I'll find something I like.
Venture into {POITags} to search for treasure
Search chests in {POITags} for {itemName}es
Visit {POITags} to search for treasure
Search coffin in {POITags} for Valuables
People still live here?\n\nI thought this place would be full of nothing but ghosts.
Music to Her Ears
Though nervous about its fearful reputation, Aethelwynn still wants to see if there's treasure in the old Cathedral and its neighboring village. Investigate each location, then return to Aethelwynn.
You... still want to help me, right? Find treasure, I mean.\n\nIf you don't, I'd understand. I could figure something out on my own.
"You sound nervous."

Nervous? Me? I suppose it's pretty obvious.\n\nThe next spot for buried treasure is the old cathedral north of the town. But I've heard terrible tales about it for years. Howling Lost, shadows that strangle intruders...
"I'll be fine. Trust me."
Heh. You're either the bravest or craziest person I've ever met.\n\nIf the cathedral looks too dangerous, you could try the village of Morgenstadt. Might be easier pickings.
I heard that a fire-spewing demon lives under the floorboards of the cathedral.\n\nIt's probably not true. Right? Right, definitely not true.
What an adorable flute! May I?\n\nI'll bet it plays the sweetest songs. Can I keep this, for my share? And the whittling knife, in case I want to add any carvings to it.
"Why? They're not worth much."
Maybe not in coin, but I love music. My father used to play for us in the evenings, to drown out the sound of--ah, never mind.\n\nI'll meet you at the southern crossroads a bit later!
Search {POITags} for clues to more treasure
Search chests at {POITags}
Read Adalbert's Confession
Search {POITags} for abandoned coffins
Search the coffin for treasure
(The large dog is clearly not interested in you.)
Dark Legacy
Though Aethelwynn said she would meet you later, she is nowhere to be seen. Mortemer's Manor and Brightrest Cemetery seem to be the most likely locations to find her.
(This is where you were supposed to meet Aethelwynn, but there's no sign of her.\n\nInstead, this large dog sits at the crossroads.)
"Hi, there. Good boy."
(The dog perks up and sniffs your clothes.\n\nHe swings his snout around, pointing toward the cluster of houses around Mortimer's Manor.)
(The dog looks at you with plaintive eyes.\n\nIt seems like he wants to come with you to Mortimer's Manor, but fears the Lost.)
The writing on this rough headstone is weathered with age.
The writing on this rough headstone is weathered with age.\n\nOn closer examination, you can make out a few words: Aethelwynn, daughter of Adalbert the carpenter.
Aethelwynn's headstone, abandoned to the wind and rain.\n\nIn time, even the faded name will disappear.
O-oh. It's y-you. S-sorry I didn't meet you like I said I would.\n\nI promise I didn't forget, I've just been… it's not important. Anyway, did you find anything good in the cemetery?
"A grave. With your name on it."
What?!Then you must've gone to… I…
"Please, tell me what's happening."
I c-can't! I'm sorry, I'm so sorry!\n\nYou've been kind, truly, but I can't face this now…
Search {POITags} for any sign of Aethelwynn
Look for coffins with potential treasure
Search {POITags} for any sign of Aethelwynn
Examine the weathered headstone
…Hi.\n\nSeems like you've met Baldr.
(The dog gives you a friendly wag of his tail, but sticks stubbornly by Aethelwynn's side.)
Reunion
Aethelwynn is finally ready to face her past and tell you what she's been seeking. Help her track down her brother-in-law by searching nearby villages, then return to her at the spirit shrine.
I owe you an explanation. And an awful lot of gratitude.\n\nI'm sure you've realized the truth by now, but I'm no treasure hunter. Sorry…
"I just want to know the truth."
It's no different from any other sorry tale of Brightwood. My mother succumbed to despair first and then the Vigil put my father "under guard."\n\nBy the end… they were ready to bury all of us alive.
"But you escaped?"

Thanks to Baldr. He chewed through the ropes the same night they dug my grave. After that, I ran.\n\nIt took me years to work up the courage to come back. The basket, the flute and knife, all the things you found belonged to my family.
"What's still missing?"
You mean, you'll keep helping me? I don't know what to say.\n\nI suppose I never found any trace of Roderick, my brother-in-law. I know his family came from a village to the west, but that's all.
Roderick used to fight for the Bright Vigil. I never heard what happened to him.\n\nI hope… no, maybe it's best not to hope at this point.
That's Roderick's shield. But you found no other trace of him?\n\nThen at least I can hope that he left the Vigil behind, and found a better life elsewhere.
Search {POITags} for clues about Roderick
Defeat the {targetName} and look for any signs of Roderick
Search {POITags} for clues about Roderick
Search chests for Roderick's belongings
Heart of Darkness (Elite)
Aethelwynn suspects that her sister's necklace is in the greedy hands of Archminister Havelock. Destroy him, find the necklace, and return to Aethelwynn at the spirit shrine.
There is one last thing. My sister Emmeline's necklace. It was the only real valuable we owned.\n\nI'll bet Archminister Havelock took it. He always was a greedy bastard.
"I'll get it back. You need closure."
And a bit of revenge. If Havelock suffers for what he did to my family, so much the better.\n\nHe'll be holed up on the island. The Vigil kept their treasury there.
I thought I'd feel better by now, but I'm just nervous. And more than a little scared for you.\n\nPlease be careful. You're a good person, and I don't want to see you hurt.
You really did it. Emmeline's necklace. See the little charm at the end?\n\nAt first, I regretted coming back. So many old ghosts. But I can start putting them to rest, thanks to you.
"What's next for you?"
Hmm. I'm not much of a treasure hunter. I should leave that to someone like you.\n\nBut traveling's been nice, and I think Baldr might like a chance to stretch his legs. Wouldn't you, old boy?
Journey to {POITags} and Destroy Archminister Havelock
Search for {itemName} from chests at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Can I tell you a secret? I thought you were a bit scary when we first met.\n\nBut I was desperate, and I took a chance. Luckily for me, you were one of the brightest souls left in Brightwood.
(Though it's taken a while, it seems Baldr has finally warmed up to you.)

Welcome to Cavalry! Meeting strangers is the only advantage of this job. Told my daughter not to join her dad’s line of work, but she never listens to me.\n\nYou need to listen to your parents. Parents know what’s good for you.
New to Brightwood? Well, you can get lost in a graveyard and fight screaming monsters or be warm in our rickety but lovable settlement.\n\nCan you guess which one I chose?
